questions.question_text: How can you create a packaged data source?

choices.A: From the Worksheet menu, select Export, and then select Data.
choices.D: From the Data pane, right-click the data connection, and then select Add to Saved Data Sources.
choices.B: From the File menu, select Save As.
choices.C: From the File menu, select Share.

discussion.content:
D
You have to select Add to Saved Data Sources
B. From the File menu, select Save As...you will have the option to either save as a .twb or a .twbx which is a packaged workbook

comments.content: I misread the question. Correct answer is D - From the Data pane, right-click the data connection, and then select Add to Saved Data Sources

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. From the Data pane, right-click the data connection, and then select Add to Saved Data Sources.

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D. 

https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/export_connection.htm
Exact, C is the good answer

choices.B: The member is added to Other
choices.C: A new group that contains only the removed member is created
choices.D: The member remains a member of the dimension but is removed from the group

discussion.content: B - The member is added to the Other group https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/sortgroup_groups_creating.htm

Selected Answer: B
ungroup member will auto added to "other group".

If you click on Include Other, Tableau will create an automatic other Group.
In the question, there is a Other Group.
So the correct answer is B

questions.question_text:
You have a group that contains three members and the Other group.

What occurs when you ungroup one of the members?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text:
You create a dashboard that tracks your team’s progress on various projects.

On the dashboard you want to display your company’s web page.

Which dashboard element should you use?

You have a workbook that contains one data source and you need to combine data from another database.

What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think it is C because Tableau requires you to first add a new data source on the canvas, not just a new connection, in order to work with a separate database.

Selected Answer: D
Def D. A data source from a workbook (ahem Tableau) will be one type of connection while "another database" could be anything and will need to be a different kind of connection.

Selected Answer: D
In the top-left corner, under the Connections pane, click "Add" or "New Connection".

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.C: Add a new data source from the data source canvas
